title: Game copyright and legal issues
content:
I have a Commander Keen game in the works. Once I get the full interface working, which is not far off, it will be mostly finished in terms of content, but not neccessarily in terms of time because I plan some cutscenes for it which can take a while.
Anyway, I need to know from all you other modders out there - what are the copyright issues about this? I have ripped sprites from all Keen games besides KeenDreams (and none from the gameboy one of course). I really don't think I'm gonna have any music from the original Keen games so don't worry about that. Oh, and good and fitting sound effects are proving hard to find on the net for free, (I don't know of any dowloads for original Keen sounds but if there is, please let me know and tell me about the copyright issues of that.) That's all the copyright things I can think of that I need to know - graphics, music, sound, and ID owning the rights to Keen. Please tell me what I need to do to be sure to say within the law about these and any other issues.
Oh, and I DON'T plan to make money off this game or anything like that - I'm just gonna put it online for free like all the other mods I know. Thanx [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] The Universe is Toast...

title: Re: Game copyright and legal issues
content:
iD doesn't care about Keen fangames unless the games are attracting attention from outside the Keen community or being sold for money. THe cease-and-desist letters would only start coming in if the game suddenly became popular.

Keeners have been ripping sprites for ages to use in fangames and never had any problems, so you won't either. The only Keen fangame that was shut down was Myth of The Moon Stone, and people were charging money for that.[url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url]
[img]http://www.toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: Game copyright and legal issues
content:
if worst comes to worst, well have to change our graphics to our own and the name to Keen Captain or something, but it shouldnt get that far

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rasta.gif[/img]

title: hmm
content: Grafix, is there some sort of commemorative article or set of screenshots or anything to let us see what the Myth Stones game was all about?  I've never seen it...

title: Keen and the Moon Stone
content:
It was actually called Keen and the Moon Stone [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

There appears to be very little mention of it on the internet - the only refrence I've seen to it is on CC314's downloads page. I do remember there being some title art for it and a GIF image that advertised the game or it's website (can't remember which). I doubt, if any article was ever written about it, it would still be around today. I would be pleased to be proved wrong, however.

I think the image of Keen that they drew for the title or whatever it was, was included in a month of TMST's 2003 Keen calender - April, possibly...--------------
[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen and the Moon Stone
content: Never heard much of this Moon Stone either.. But yeah, you're safe if the game 'stays' in Keen community. The only fan game project that can be freezed when ready is z-1's game. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Keen and the Moon Stone
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]The only fan game project that can be freezed when ready is z-1's game.[hr][/quote]They can lock me up, but the game will prevail! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-pirate.gif[/img]

It's unlikely that the big game companies would do anything about a mod or fan game if it's for free. They don't care much about 2D platform games anymore... unfortunately [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen and the Moon Stone
content: Unfortunately, the website for the Moon Stone game disappeared soon after they had removed Keen from the plot.[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: Keen and the Moon Stone
content: And it presumably does not reside in the Wayback archive?

title: * and the Moon Stone
content:
"It's unlikely that the big game companies would do anything about a mod or fan game if it's for free. They don't care much about 2D platform games anymore... unfortunately [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] "
You're right. (And I was just joking.)

I'd like to check the Wayback archive in case there is anything. But I don't know the URL. Anyone knows?You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Alrighty
content:
Ok, thanx, all, for the help. But one more thing. Since Keen is owned by ID, what do I need to have said in my game that's the disclaimer or w/e. I've seen games where they say something like, "Commander Keen is owned by ID and I do not claim to have the rights to this or w/e" Can someone tell me exactaly what I need to say for that? I'll proly put it in the Title Screen and the credits. Thanx again.

OH! and if the moderators dont mind me changing the subject, I need some sound effects for my game. I've painfully learned that finding good sound effects on the web is most difficult. If only Goodle had a sound search the way they have a image search.
The sounds I need are:
gun reloading (for neural stunner), pogo sound, (yes, I got pogo working), jump sound too I guess, and nueral stunner shooting sound.
The ones that K4-6 have too, I'd like them to be as close as possible to that. So if anyone knows of a good sound library out there, please let me know. And they have to be sounds legal to download and use in a free game like this. Thanx [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] The Universe is Toast...

title: Re: Alrighty
content: [url=http://dosclassics.com/download.php?id=249]Try This[/url]-Genius314

title: Re: Alrighty
content:
sounds? you can find tons of libraries quick. as for specific sounds... I'll check.

I don't have sound on this comp. right at the moment but I'll try to find some things you can browse and select.

[url=http://www2.shastacollege.edu/rlightfoot/Sound%20Files/Sound%20effects/gunreload.wav]www2.shastacollege.edu/rl...reload.wav[/url]
[url=http://www.webplaces.com/html/sounds.htm]www.webplaces.com/html/sounds.htm[/url]
[url=http://www.space1999.net/~moonbase99/sfx/stungun1.wav]www.space1999.net/~moonba...ungun1.wav[/url]

really I don't think there's any good place to get dossy keen sounds like the neural stunner in 2nd trilogy and the pogo sound but I'll keep looking for you.

Wait are these sounds for a mod for 123 or 456?[center][img]http://members.cox.net/aborlan/sig/sigpng.png[/img]
Crisp Grayscale Signature! 2152 bytes!
[/center]

title: not a mod, exactaly
content:
This isn't a mod that uses a keen game engine, this is programmed completely from scratch. I'm just using a bunch of Keen sprites from K1-3 and K4-6.

BTW, Grafix5000, has there ever been a Keen fangame that became too popular that ID stopped it?The Universe is Toast...

title: Re: not a mod, exactaly
content:
I believe Id di stop a certain Keen fangame, but mostly they view us as some sort of brown substance attached to the bottom of their shoes.A proud member of the signature stealing society

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: ID Please!!!
content:
ID really won't care about anything you do, unless:

1) You're making money on their IDea ([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ).
2) You don't release any of Keen's source code.
3) You say you made keen.
4) They don't make any money on Doom IV game because everbody wants to play your game, and doesn't give a crap for Doom any more.

But I don't think you'll do anything like the above (though I'd be worried about #4)

-- NAJAWA --

Edited: (Changed Duke to Doom) Better?

title: Re: ID Please!!!
content: But Duke Nukem's not developed or published by iD and never has been.
